title: Police Commission gazette issued
body: The interim government on Tuesday issued a gazette announcing the formation of a five-member Police Commission. According to the gazette, the commission will be headed by a retired Supreme Court judge. Its other members will include a retired Grade-1 officer who previously served as a district magistrate, a retired additional inspector general of police, a university professor, and an expert in human rights or good governance. The president will appoint the chair and members of the commission based on recommendations from a selection committee. The selection committee will consist of a judge from the Appellate Division, the chairperson of the National Human Rights Commission, the cabinet secretary, one lawmaker each from the treasury and opposition benches, the home secretary, and the chairman of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission.
